channel.title: Need a little .bat Code
channel.description:
Okay, here's my dilemma: I like to make a back-up of my server... a lot, and it's getting annoying to have to keep on going 'Copy All Files', and then go to the back-up folder, and 'Paste All Files' after deleting all the current files in the back-up folder.
So, is it possible anybody could make me a .bat file or something to copy my whole server source folder, and paste it in the back-up folder.
If you make a .bat file for this, I will be able to change the file names, so you can put whatever there, but please just make it working. lol
Or, even better, if you could make it so that it makes a NEW folder somewhere, with the name being the date, and then '-BackUp' Ex.: 3-27-08-BackUp
Something like that.
Sorry if that's confusing. :P
Thanks in advance, Zach
PS. I'm going AFK for a bit, but will be back to check this thread. Thanks!
Just add the .bat file in an attachment. =]

item.title: Need a little .bat Code
item.dc:creator: @o0_v_1_n_o0 o0 v 1 n o0
item.description:
@o0_v_1_n_o0 wrote:

@echo off Color F5 title Beautifying and Backing up java files - By Mike Vartan echo. echo Beautifying and Backing up your java files - By Mike Vartan echo. jacobe *.java for /f "tokens=1-5 delims=/ " %%d in ("%date%") do md BACKUP\%%e-%%f-%%g for /f "tokens=1-5 delims=/ " %%d in ("%date%") do move *.java BACKUP/%%e-%%f-%%g/ rename *.java.jacobe *. cls title Backing up mysql database! - By Mike Vartan echo Finished beautifying and backing up files echo Now attempting to backup the database for /f "tokens=1-5 delims=/ " %%d in ("%date%") do "C:\Program Files\MySQL\MySQL Server 5.0\bin\mysqldump.exe" -u USER -pPASSWORD DATABASE > BACKUP/%%e-%%f-%%g/database.sql echo. echo. echo done! pause

Thats from zdr, the only thing I know of

Read full topic

item.title: Need a little .bat Code
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Okay, here’s my dilemma:
I like to make a back-up of my server… a lot, and it’s getting annoying to have to keep on going ‘Copy All Files’, and then go to the back-up folder, and ‘Paste All Files’ after deleting all the current files in the back-up folder.

So, is it possible anybody could make me a .bat file or something to copy my whole server source folder, and paste it in the back-up folder.

If you make a .bat file for this, I will be able to change the file names, so you can put whatever there, but please just make it working. lol

Or, even better, if you could make it so that it makes a NEW folder somewhere, with the name being the date, and then ‘-BackUp’
Ex.: 3-27-08-BackUp

Something like that.

Sorry if that’s confusing.

Thanks in advance,
Zach

PS. I’m going AFK for a bit, but will be back to check this thread. Thanks!

Just add the .bat file in an attachment. =]

Read full topic
